event.location: The incident began as a mini bus was descending a hill in the Table Mountain area of KwaZulu-Natal Province near Pietermaritzburg, about 300 miles south of Johannesburg.
event.summary: 03/05/1993: 10 supporters of the African National Congress were gunned down in South Africa's KwaZulu-Natal province. Inkatha Freedom Party was suspected in the killings. 3 injuries and 10 casualties resulted from the attack.
event.corp1: Supporters of the African National Congress
event.target1: Supporters of the African National Congress
event.motive: The attack may have been a revenge killing for the earlier murder of six children on Tuesday, that the Inkatha Freedom Party had accused the African National Congress of committing.
event.addnotes: This attack may have been a revenge attack for an earlier incident on March 2, in which 6 children were killed. 3 injuries and 10 casualties resulted from the attack. Political rivalry between the African National Congress and Inkatha Freedom Party was suspected of being the cause of the violence.
event.scite1: Rob Golden, “Attacks Threaten to Derail South African Negotiations,” CNN, March 6, 1993.
event.scite2: “Police say killing of 10 may be revenge attack,” United Press International, March 6, 1993.
